headline: Fact Check: Delhi’s infamous Shahrukh has nothing to do with this budding actor
fact_check_details: ConclusionAnurag Mishra and Shahrukh are two different people

headline: Fact Check: The truth behind police distributing ‘tasbih’ to Muslims in Maharashtra
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral video is from the National Integration Week observed every year.

headline: Fact Check: Holding breath for 10 seconds is not a coronavirus test
fact_check_details: ConclusionNo, you can’t test for coronavirus like this

headline: Fact Check: Fake news about DCP’s death in Delhi violence goes viral
fact_check_details: ConclusionTill the time of filing this story, DCP Sharma was out of danger.

headline: Fact Check: Do you risk burning your hands after applying sanitisers?
fact_check_details: ConclusionIt is a hoax. Alcohol in hand sanitisers evaporate completely once applied on the hands

headline: Fact Check: This viral sign taking a dig at Islam is not a real billboard
fact_check_details: ConclusionNo such hoarding has been put up. The image was created through an app.

headline: Fact check: Pic of woman breastfeeding baby across fence is not from detention camp in India
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe image is from Argentina.

headline: Fact Check: Nepali Tiktok stars photo passed off as Finnish ministers
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis is a viral image of four Tiktok stars in Nepal.

headline: Fact check: Nasimuddin Siddiqui targetted for a radical Muslim comment that he didn't make
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe person seen in the viral video is Samajwadi leader Maviya Ali and not Nasimmudin Siddiqui.

headline: Fact Check: No, China has not sought permission to kill 20,000 coronavirus patients
fact_check_details: ConclusionNo media outlet has reported it. Also, the claim originates from a rather suspicious website.

headline: Fact Check: No, Akshay Kumar never said this about Nathuram Godse
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral post is the screenshot of a tweet from a fake account.

headline: Fact Check: This viral audio clip on coronavirus is not Dr Devi Shetty's
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral clip has been falsely attributed to Dr Devi Shetty.

headline: Fact Check: This picture of coffins has no relation to Covid-19 deaths in Italy
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe picture is indeed from Italy but is seven years old and has nothing to do with the coronavirus outbreak.

headline: Fact Check: Has the Covid-19 lockdown returned dolphins and swans to Italian waterways?
fact_check_details: ConclusionSuch sightings are not a new phenomena and have no relation to the lockdown.

headline: Fact Check: Hilarious video of woman slapping girl goes viral linking it to CAA
fact_check_details: ConclusionFour-year-old video of flash mob dance has no relation to CAA.

headline: Fact Check: Images of fake notes from Telangana go viral linking them to RSS and Gujarat
fact_check_details: ConclusionImages are from Telangana. No proof of RSS connection with Ketan Dave, also linked to fake notes.

headline: Fact Check: Viral post claims China's whistleblower doctor suggested tea cures Covid-19
fact_check_details: ConclusionNo scientific proof as of yet, CNN didn’t publish this news.

headline: Fact Check: Bogus info about govt spraying chemicals to kill coronavirus goes viral
fact_check_details: ConclusionThere is no such action plan by the government.

headline: Fact check: False coronavirus quote attributed to US President Donald Trump
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe quote has been on the internet for over a decade attributing it to different people at different times.

headline: Fact Check: Old pictures of Kanika Kapoor with Prince Charles go viral after coronavirus hits royal family
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral pictures of Kanika Kapoor meeting Prince Charles are old.

headline: Fact Check: Visuals from Croatia earthquake passed off as corona crisis in Italy
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe images are from Croatia after it was hit by an earthquake on March 22.

headline: Fact Check: Do not trust this viral remedy of using hairdryer to cure coronavirus
fact_check_details: ConclusionThere is no proven evidence that hot air application through a hairdryer will cure coronavirus.

headline: Fact Check: Don't believe this home remedy to cure Covid-19
fact_check_details: ConclusionThere is no scientific proof of the claim; WHO does not mention this remedy.

headline: Fact Check: This viral video of police lathi-charge is not from Delhi
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis incident happened in Bulandshahr, Uttar Pradesh, in December last year.

headline: Fact Check: No, this US hospital did not say alcohol can keep Covid-19 at bay
fact_check_details: ConclusionSaint Luke's Hospital hasn't released any such advisory.

headline: Fact Check: Did a policeman get beaten up while enforcing corona lockdown?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe photos are three years old and have nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.

headline: Fact Check: No, Bangla has not been declared the second language of London
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe British government has made no such announcement

headline: Fact Check: Is this Amit Shah touching the feet of Swami Nithyananda?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe man touching the feet of Nithyananda is the High Commissioner of Mauritius in India, Jagdishwar Goburdhun.

headline: Fact Check: Will Tata Group not hire from JNU anymore?
fact_check_details: ConclusionTata Group has not made any such announcement

headline: Fact check: Panic buying in Germany? This video is 9 years old
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe video is 9 years old and has nothing to do with Covid-19.

headline: Fact Check: Photo of Eid procession in Bangladesh passed off as CAB protest in Mumbai
fact_check_details: ConclusionImage is from Eid procession in Bangladesh

headline: Fact Check: World is not going to end on April 29
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe world will not end as this asteroid will fly past Earth at an approximate distance of 3.9 million miles.

headline: Fact Check: Is this baby Dalai Lama with Mahatma Gandhi?
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral photo is morphed.

headline: Fact Check: Photoshopped image of 'floating rock' flies around Internet
fact_check_details: ConclusionIt is a photoshopped image.

headline: Fact Check: WHO never asked people to avoid bakery items due to coronavirus
fact_check_details: ConclusionWHO has not issued any such advisory. Till now, there is no evidence that bakery items get easily contaminated by coronavirus.

headline: Fact Check: This viral video of mass graves is not from Italy but from a TV series
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral video is part of a TV series called Pandemic.

headline: Fact Check: False claim saying Modi pays tribute to Godse resurfaces
fact_check_details: ConclusionModi is not paying tribute to Godse but Deen Dayal Upadhyaya.

headline: Fact Check: Now Laxmi faces the 'Chhapaak' of fake news
fact_check_details: ConclusionLaxmi Agarwal has not made any such statement.

headline: Fact Check: Social media users give misleading twist to PM Modi's concept of 'Janta curfew'
fact_check_details: ConclusionThere is no scientific proof to the claim as yet.

headline: Fact Check: Did Indira Gandhi enter JNU with police and force Sitaram Yechury to apologise?
fact_check_details: ConclusionIndira Gandhi did not enter JNU with police and beat Sitaram Yechury. She did not force Yechury to resign or read an apology for protesting against Emergency.

headline: Fact Check: Co-workers prank goes viral with deadly claim
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe man in the viral image didn’t suffer a heart attack, he actually has fallen asleep.

headline: Fact Check: Women's Day picture from Maharashtra goes viral with misleading claim
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe 14-year-old girl was made DSP for a day in Maharashtra's Buldhana district as part of International Women's Day celebrations.

headline: Fact Check: Did Balotelli make a snide remark about Messi?
fact_check_details: ConclusionBalotelli never said this.

headline: Fact Check: Are these 69 siblings from one mother? It's half true
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe image is of a man who had multiple wives and children

headline: Fact Check: Republican Congressman targets Obama on Iran with morphed image
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral image is morphed.

headline: Fact Check: Disgusting video of woman mixing urine in food goes viral with communal spin
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe incident is nine years old and the maid was not a Muslim.

headline: Fact Check: No, India has not developed any treatment for coronavirus
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe headline of the viral article is misleading. So far, India has not claimed any such discovery.

headline: Fact Check: Truth behind mother fox feeding koalas during Australia bushfires
fact_check_details: ConclusionSix-year-old video has no relation with Australian bushfires. Mother fox is feeding her kits and not koalas.

headline: Fact Check: Bullied Australian kid Quaden Bayles did not commit suicide
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis is a hoax

headline: Fact Check: Amanatullah Khan's tweet doctored to give it communal twist
fact_check_details: ConclusionAmanatullah Khan's tweet was doctored

headline: Fact Check: Did a woman throw dirty water at Arvind Kejriwal?
fact_check_details: Conclusion Viral photo is of Kejriwal campaigning for the Bawana by-election in August 2017. No incident of anyone throwing water on him that time was reported.

headline: Fact Check: Has Saamana changed masthead to green with 'secular' tagline?
fact_check_details: Conclusion‘Saamana’ masthead and tagline remain the same. Masthead is still saffron and tagline says it speaks of “burning Hindutva issues”.

headline: Fact Check: Were these animals rescued from the Australian bush fires?
fact_check_details: ConclusionMost of the images are old and not from Australia.

headline: Fact Check: This post on biryani is too sour to consume
fact_check_details: ConclusionImages used in the viral post are unrelated and the post is false

headline: Fact Check: Taliban suicide bomber passed off as Delhi riot accused
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral image is 10 years old and of a Taliban suicide bomber caught in Afghanistan. The NIA and UP police raids are two years old.

headline: Fact Check: BR Ambedkar's great-grandson mistakes cattle breed for caste
fact_check_details: Conclusion'Brahman Pies' has nothing to do with the Indian caste 'Brahmin'. The name 'Brahman Pies' comes after cattle breed 'Brahman'.

headline: Fact Check: No, Olympics did not redesign its logo on social distancing theme
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe Tokyo Olympics logo has not been redesigned.

headline: Fact Check: No, US health body has not recommended shaving facial hair to prevent coronavirus
fact_check_details: ConclusionNo such recommendations have been made by CDC so far.

headline: Fact Check: Fake AAP candidates list goes viral with communal spin
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral list is fake, as AAP is yet to make any announcement.

headline: Fact Check: Video of little girl crying goes viral with misleading claim
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe video is almost two years old and the girl has been reunited with her family

headline: Fact Check: Popular story about this historic pic of Gandhi is far from truth
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe picture was taken in 1937 at Mumbai's Juhu beach.

headline: Fact Check: This European kid was not beaten up by a Muslim immigrant for having blue eyes
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe child seen in the picture was attacked by a Rottweiler at her home in Cardiff, UK, back in 2008.

headline: Fact Check: Did former European Commission prez say Indian voters are foolish?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe former EC president never made this statement.

headline: Fact Check: Did this SFI worker fake injuries after violence at JNU?
fact_check_details: ConclusionMedical reports confirm Soori Krishnan’s physical injuries

headline: Fact Check: Did police publicly kill coronavirus-infected woman in China?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe woman in the viral video was taken into custody for violating traffic restrictions in China’s Heilongjiang province.

headline: Fact Check: No, this is not a fingerprint shaped village in Germany
fact_check_details: Conclusion The viral photo is a digital artwork of an artist.

headline: Fact Check: Did Rahul Gandhi salute the Tricolour with his left hand?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral image is inverted laterally. In the original picture, Rahul Gandhi was seen saluting with his right hand.

headline: Fact Check: Fake names of Hyderabad rape accused go viral with communal twist
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe names of the accused were Mohammad Areef, Jollu Shiva, Jollu Naveen and Chintakunta Chennakeshavulu.

headline: Fact Check: No, this picture is not about brutality of Delhi Police
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis is a 10-year-old picture from Dhaka, Bangladesh.

headline: Fact Check: Delhi govt advert for riot victims morphed with communal twist
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral image is morphed. The original advertisement does not include the name of any religion.

headline: Fact Check: News about four-day working week in Finland is too good to be true
fact_check_details: ConclusionSix hours work shifts and four day working week is not one of Finnish government agendas.

headline: Fact Check: Is the Chinese govt burning pigs alive to contain coronavirus?
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral video is around a year old and has nothing to do with coronavirus in China

headline: Fact Check: False message of Assam lockdown goes viral amid Covid-19 scare
fact_check_details: ConclusionNo such decision has been taken by the Assam government so far

headline: Fact Check: Old picture of Kejriwal-Imran Khan meet linked to Delhi election
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral image is four years old and has no relation with Delhi election.

headline: Fact Check: PM Modi's image photoshopped along with starving woman from Africa
fact_check_details: ConclusionPM Modi's image is photoshopped. The image of the woman with a child is from Africa.

headline: Fact Check: Mainstream media fall for crazy satire story on viagra-filled river
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis is a satirical article.

headline: Fact Check: Truth behind viral post showing Chinese biz tycoon Jack Ma’s struggle
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe boy encircled in the photo is reportedly a lookalike of Jack Ma.

headline: Fact Check: This viral video is not of Kobe Bryant’s chopper crash
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral video is from UAE and more than a year old

headline: Fact Check: RPF constable’s death in accident linked to anti-CAA violence
fact_check_details: ConclusionRPF constable Dharmendra Meena was killed in a road accident

headline: Fact Check: No, Akbaruddin Owaisi is not pleading for help because of Amit Shah
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe video of him praying is from 2014; Amit Shah became Union Home minister in 2019

headline: Fact Check: Before US president’s visit, a sensational Trump lookalike video goes viral
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe man seen in the viral video is a Trump impersonator.

headline: Fact Check: Police did not fix timings for grocery and medical stores in Mumbai
fact_check_details: ConclusionIt is a hoax. The Mumbai Police commissioner has not issued any such order

headline: Fact Check: Truth behind video of people rioting on London streets fearing coronavirus lockdown
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe video is almost nine years old and from the London riots in 2011.

headline: Fact Check: This is not the bike accident video of Tamil actor Ajith Kumar
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe video is seven years old and has no connection to Ajith Kumar.

headline: Fact check: No, lawyers are not exempted  at Toll plazas on the national highways
fact_check_details: ConclusionThere is no exemption as yet to lawyers.

headline: Fact Check: This is not Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose’s wife Emilie Schenkl
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral photo is of French-born right-wing thinker Maximine Portaz who later changed her name to Savitri Devi

headline: Fact Check: Clip of video game passed off as US shooting down Iranian missiles
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis is a clip from a video game

headline: Fact Check: Photoshopped image passed off as live suicide from Dubai’s Burj Khalifa
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral image is photoshopped. The picture is not of Burj Khalifa but it is Egypt’s Cairo Tower.

headline: Fact Check: No, gargling with warm salt water can't save you from coronavirus
fact_check_details: ConclusionAt present, there is no study or evidence to support the claim

headline: Fact check: No, Jio has not offered Rs 498 free recharge amid coronavirus lockdown
fact_check_details: ConclusionJio officially denied the claim on their official Twitter handle

headline: Fact Check: Actor Tom Hanks is taken ill by COVID-19, but this is a hoax
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis is a hoax.

headline: Fact Check: Touching image of kangaroo hugging woman has no relation to Australian bush fires
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe kangaroo was rescued as an orphan three years ago by the staff of an Australian kangaroo sanctuary

headline: Fact Check: No, this is not ABVP man in the garb of Delhi police
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe man in civil clothes and police gear is not ABVP leader. But the man in the video kicking another man is indeed Bharat Sharma.

headline: Fact Check: Social media raps a flawed tune. Eminem is not down with coronavirus
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral post is a hoax.

headline: Fact Check: Know the truth behind viral video of passenger agitation at Delhi airport
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis incident took place a few days back at IGIA in relation to mandatory coronavirus screening

headline: Fact Check: Eight-year-old photo passed off as police atrocities on Jamia students
fact_check_details: ConclusionPicture is eight years old and from Lucknow

headline: Fact Check: Is this the video of US drone strike that killed Iranian general Soleimani?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe video is a clipping of a video game and has nothing to do with Soleimani’s killing.

headline: Fact Check: Viral post saying Italians are throwing their money on the streets is false
fact_check_details: ConclusionThese are old pictures from Venezuela and have nothing to do with the Covid-19 pandemic

headline: Fact Check: Aishe Ghosh's hand injury is not shifting, the photo is morphed.
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral photo showing Ghosh’s right hand bandaged has been flipped. She was injured on her left hand.

headline: Fact Check: Irfan Pathan was meeting fans in Kolkata, not protesters at Shaheen Bagh
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral video is from Irfan Pathan’s visit to Kolkata

headline: Fact check: No, Nirmala Sitharaman never said onion price rise doesn’t matter to her
fact_check_details: ConclusionNirmala Sitharaman never said onion price rise doesn’t matter to her.

headline: Fact Check: These images of US soldiers' coffins don't show Iran's revenge
fact_check_details: ConclusionPhotos are quite old and have no relation with the recent attack.

headline: Fact Check: How a US warship pushed Navy Day into a whirlpool of controversies
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe image used in the Navy Day greetings is of a US warship

headline: Fact Check: Old pic of sick chicken passed off as coronavirus infected in Bengaluru
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral image of sick chicken is old and not related to coronavirus.

headline: Fact Check: No, this is not the PM of Italy crying over Covid-19 deaths
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe man seen crying in the picture is Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and the incident has nothing to do with the Covid-19 outbreak

headline: Fact Check: No, clapping together at 5 pm during Janta curfew will not kill coronavirus
fact_check_details: ConclusionThere is no proven evidence that vibration created by collectively clapping can destroy coronavirus.

headline: Fact Check: No, this is not the son of IB operative Ankit Sharma killed in Delhi riots
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe picture was taken at the funeral of one Mudassir Khan, another victim of the violence.

headline: Fact Check- Incident of a man kidnapped and raped by three women is not from Telangana
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe incident happened in South Africa. The image is of a different incident.

headline: Fact Check: Is this Rahul Gandhi lying on the ground after a trip-and-fall?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe man seen lying on the ground is Robert Vadra, who had fainted during a prize distribution event

headline: Fact Check: Do not believe this hoax about the death of Kobe Bryant’s wife
fact_check_details: ConclusionIt is a hoax

headline: Fact Check: Old, unrelated video of bats streaming out from a roof linked to coronavirus outbreak
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe viral video is around nine years old and is from Miami, USA.

headline: Fact Check: Old photo of Rahul Gandhi and Arvind Kejriwal goes viral with misleading claim
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis is an old photo, taken at Rashtrapati Bhavan on January 26, 2018.

headline: Fact Check: Old video passed off as man in Shaheen Bagh spitting on food for distribution
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe video is at least two years old and not from Delhi.

headline: Fact Check: No, Putin has not unleashed lions on Russian streets to enforce Corona lockdown
fact_check_details: Conclusion This picture is from Johannesburg in South Africa and about four years old

headline: Fact Check: Porn pics used to cook up a story about rape by Indian soldiers
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe story described in the article is cooked up by using images from multiple unrelated websites.

headline: Fact Check: Taj Mahal being hosed down to welcome Donald Trump? No, this is not Agra
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe monument in the viral video is a replica of the Taj Mahal in Bhopal.

headline: Fact Check: Did police thrash accused in rape and murder of Telangana vet in public?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe incident is from Chittoor in Andhra Pradesh where police are beating up a man accused of raping a Class 5 girl.

headline: Fact Check: No, this COVID-19 patient is not the wife of Canadian PM Justin Trudeau
fact_check_details: Conclusion Woman seen in the video is not the wife of Justin Trudeau but a COVID-19 patient from London

headline: Fact Check: Is Indira Gandhi posing with her husband and father-in-law in this photo?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe photo is of Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, Russian artist Nicholas Roerich and Gandhi's aide Yunus Khan.

headline: Fact Check: Old video of pro-Khalistan rally passed off as anti-NRC stir in Punjab
fact_check_details: ConclusionVideo is three years old and has nothing to do with the anti-NRC stir.

headline: Fact Check: Love in the time of Corona? Know the truth behind this viral image
fact_check_details: ConclusionThis photograph was taken in Barcelona airport, Spain. No such news report of the Italian doctor couple found.

headline: Fact Check: This story about woman falling from Eiffel Tower is too good to be true
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe woman in the viral image never attempted suicide from Eiffel Tower. The viral story is partially true.

headline: Fact Check: Tarek Fatah loads up on fake again, drops a film clip to mislead on polio
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral video is a scene from a Pakistani film Load Wedding

headline: Fact Check: Before Trump’s visit, slum image from Mumbai passed off as Gujarat on social media
fact_check_details: ConclusionViral images have no connection with Gujarat.

headline: Fact Check: Did this man track down and brutally torture his three-year-old daughter's rapist?
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe man in the photo was arrested by South African police for allegedly looting and clashing with foreign residents

headline: Fact Check: Tarek Fatah passes off old video with communal slogans as recent one from Delhi
fact_check_details: ConclusionThe video is more than two years old and from Rajasthan’s Udaipur
